meanings.definition: To establish a colony in (a place) again.
meanings.sent1: After many years, the explorers decided to recolonize the deserted island.
meanings.sent2: The settlers recolonized the valley after it had been abandoned for decades.
meanings.sent3: The ants decided to recolonize the picnic area, much to the dismay of the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The idea to recolonize the old fort with new inhabitants sparked excitement among the locals.
meanings.sent5: The scientists observed how nature recolonizes areas devastated by wildfires.

meanings.definition: To settle in (a place) again with a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The nomadic tribe planned to recolonize the fertile plains for farming.
meanings.sent2: Families from the city decided to recolonize the coastal town for a quieter life.
meanings.sent3: The students jokingly discussed their plan to recolonize the school cafeteria during lunchtime.
meanings.sent4: The birds began to recolonize the trees in the park, filling the air with chirps and songs.
meanings.sent5: The refugees hoped to recolonize their war-torn homeland once peace was restored.

meanings.definition: To take control of (a place) again.
meanings.sent1: The invaders sought to recolonize the conquered lands after the war.
meanings.sent2: The rebel forces aimed to recolonize the capital city and overthrow the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully pretended to recolonize the playground from imaginary invaders.
meanings.sent4: The company planned to recolonize the market with their innovative products.
meanings.sent5: The virus quickly recolonizes the body if not completely eradicated by treatment.
